tweets.text: Lessons in river hydrology - dredging a river increases flow exacerbating flood peaks to make flooding more likely. SLOW the flow. The landowner knows what is best for his/her farm business. The EA has to take a wider view. @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency https://t.co/Vj6w0X4y8k
Let's hope the @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK do the right thing and throw the book at him... https://t.co/XzMY0XtcGW

Sites in #Reigate got a surprise knock on the door as we were out with @BTPSurrey @reigatebanstead and @WeAreOpenreach checking sites and looking for metal theft.

Following our visits, we'll do further investigations and consider what appropriate enforcement action is needed. https://t.co/GNOjZAvKwk
beautiful day in Salford at Kersal Wetlands, 15 Grey Herons agree @SalfordCouncil @EnvAgencyNW @salboyltd @USWSociety @SalfordEast @KersalDale @VisitSalford https://t.co/BbzHU5JVhC

@GarethSimkins Welcome to my world @GarethSimkins. Too easy to focus on the compliant operators and keep kicking the good guys. @EnvAgency have lost a lot of respect due to their reluctance to tackle difficult issues. #JUWC seems to have had little impact.

If @EnvAgency don’t address criminal operators this kind of action only makes the legitimate sector less competitive. We all want higher standards but the criminals have to be taken out of action. What happened to #JUWC? #missinginaction https://t.co/c73aTJ9d0T via @letsrecycle

urls.title: Agency moves to clarify appropriate measures guidance - letsrecycle.com
urls.description: The Environment Agency’s senior advisor for site-based regulation, Howard Leberman, has moved to clarify aspects of recently published proposed guidance for permitted facilities taking non-hazardous and inert waste. Speaking at the National Civic Amenity Site (NCAS) Conference, Mr Leberman reiterated that the proposed regulations are not mandatory or definitive, but look to “frame the discussion and act as a starting...

tweets.text: Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR

Last week @NaturalEngland, @ForestryComm and @EnvAgency joined forces to stop damage to the River Lugg. Evidence was collected and is now being assessed . A legal investigation is  underway. Read more here: https://t.co/PL4IkhJtgo

Last week @NaturalEngland , @ForestryComm and @EnvAgency joined forces to stop damage to the River Lugg. Evidence was collected and is now being assessed . A legal investigation is  underway. Read more here: https://t.co/xMIzo9dITb

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

tweets.text:
Slow The Flow feature tonight on BBC - Panorama, Britain's Wild Weather, discussing climate change and our project with The National Trust at Hardcastle Crags.
Tune in at 7pm tonight while you're having you tea!!
https://t.co/iXGT9Y7eEI
@HardcastleNT  @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE

We are working with our colleagues from @EnvAgencyMids and @ForestryComm on a joint investigation into damage reported on the #SSSI area of the #RiverLugg in Herefordshire

https://t.co/xWL4duHrQN

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

Shocked and appalled at this damage to a protected wildlife site. The River Lugg is home to many threatened invertebrates. We hope that @NaturalEngland and @EnvAgency take appropriate action to ensure the site is restored, and protected for the future
https://t.co/ZLI76RRJAt
@stillawake Yet the @EnvAgency state they will not investigate as no ecological damage was done.. No one is batting any fucking eyelids here.

Important flood risk information  https://t.co/YLj35kgKFC 
💧🏡
Have you signed up to receive flood alerts from @EnvAgency ?? 
👇👇
If not it's quick and easy to do --> follow this link https://t.co/ke4TBo01HI
@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA Ash, @DaveThroupEA is a good ‘un and if anything can be done, it will be done, certainly on the ground.
@MildnhallPolice @NSRAPT @SuffolkFire @EnvAgencyAnglia Please may you give us the exact location of incident plus extent of A142 closure. Many thanks...and take care everyone on scene! 🙏

To find out more about the project, follow the link: https://t.co/kUqW6LwbQO

#DNAire #AireRiversTrust #EnvironmentAgency #Riverrestoration https://t.co/DT4zVd1mcj
👏👏👏 @Ian_R_ https://t.co/sIe5JAqZtr
@NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @EnvAgency Tough one this, flood defenses/dredging I can understand if the matter is of such importance but to this level of destruction?

A reminder of what was happening in August reported to the EA & dismissed as Agricultural runoff due to heavy rainfall💩Sept collected a sample of the runoff & tested by @N_Rivers_Trust Ammonia 480mg PL Phosphate 80mg PL solids off the scale EA then took action 🤷‍♂️Aug film 💩 https://t.co/lssO27EI7d https://t.co/62JgFIlV5p

@earlythorn @EnvAgencyNW Hi, these barriers were put up by the Environment Agency due to safety issues with the embankment at Lunt Meadows. Unfortunately they've been vandalised in this way on a number of occasions so are being removed shortly.

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That’s why we’re putting £1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

Update on the destruction of the river Lugg story. The landowner and the council says he was given permission undertake the works from the EA. DEFRA and the EA wouldn't comment on this when I asked this morning. The truth will out! Soon, I hope.
https://t.co/XoC6E7Rbp2
Our field operations staff have been out clearing trash screens including this one at Grimscar Dyke in #Huddersfield after yesterday's heavy rainfall.  #FloodReady #floodaware https://t.co/of4fljdwlP
@DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgency Cancel the vanity project #HS2 and save the mature trees from being grubbed up. Value what we have already .

Last Friday site visits with @EnvAgencyNW who have been instrumental in supporting the development of our @DouglasPilot @GroundworkCLM Fisheries Strategy #Lancashire Thanks to all involved @RibbleTrust @Mike_Forty we’re improving Fish Passage along the River Douglas! 🐠 🐟 🎣 https://t.co/4X4dcifG0M
